title: Frederic Raurell
text:
Frederic Raurell i Ges (<a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>, 1930) is a <a href="Catalonia">Catalan</a> <a href="Order%20of%20Friars%20Minor%20Capuchin">Capuchin</a>. He is <a href="doctor%20%28title%29">doctor</a> in theology and graduated in <a href="Bible">biblical</a> and <a href="Semitic%20studies">Semitic studies</a>.
Life.
He has taught in the schools of the <a href="Sarri%C3%A0%20Capuchins">Sarrià Capuchins</a> and he is exegesis and hermeneutics teacher in the <a href="Pontifical%20University%20Antonianum">Pontifical University Antonianum</a> in Rome and in the . He is founder of the <a href="Biblical%20Association%20of%20Catalonia">Biblical Association of Catalonia</a>, of the "International Organization for the Study of the Old Testament" and of the "International Organization for Septuagint and Cognate Studies". He collaborated in the Bible of the <a href="Catalan%20Biblical%20Foundation">Catalan Biblical Foundation</a> and in the "Comments to the Office of Readings". He is codirector of the review "Estudios Eclesiásticos", where he has published several studies. He was a founder member of the first Editorial Board of <a href="Catalan%20Journal%20of%20Theology">Catalan Journal of Theology</a>.
He has also written about Franciscan matters. Lately he has also made some researches about his own family, about <a href="Sarri%C3%A0%2C%20Barcelona">Sarrià</a>, and about the time of the <a href="Spanish%20Civil%20War">Spanish Civil War</a>.
